data.name: rasusa
data.description: Randomly subsample sequencing reads to a specified coverage

evidence: "Randomly subsample sequencing reads to a specified coverage" and usage examples like `rasusa reads --coverage 30 --genome-size 4.6mb in.fq` show it is a command-line tool users run directly for data processing.

The tool is designed for subsampling sequencing reads/alignments used in genomics research, and the README includes a JOSS citation: "Rasusa: Randomly subsample sequencing reads to a specified coverage" indicating it directly contributes to research analyses.
